original: Physician-assisted suicide, also known as euthanasia, presents a complex ethical dilemma for doctors. On one hand, physicians have a primary obligation to heal and preserve life. On the other hand, there is a growing recognition of an individual's autonomy to make decisions about their own life, even when it comes to end-of-life situations. However, allowing euthanasia can lead to potential harm a
